SEARCH
Package MonitorService

Class MonitorService

java.lang.Object
MonitorService.MonitorService
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, ActorListener
public class MonitorService extends Object implements ActorListener
The MonitorService class is used to monitor the activity of actors in a system. It implements the ActorListener interface, which allows it to receive updates on events that occur within the system.

    • getTraffic

      public Map<String,List<String>> getTraffic()
      This method returns the number of messages received by each actor, grouped by the level of traffic (LOW, MEDIUM, or HIGH).
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are the levels of traffic and the values are lists of actors that fall into that category.

    • getNumberOfMessages

      public int getNumberOfMessages(String name)
      This method returns the number of messages received by the specified actor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the actor.
      Returns:
      the number of messages received by the actor.

    • getSentMessages

      public Map<String,List<Message>> getSentMessages()
      This method returns a map of all sent messages, grouped by the sender.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are the names of the actors that sent the messages and the values are lists of the messages sent by that actor.

    • getReceivedMessages

      public Map<Actor,List<Message>> getReceivedMessages()
      Returns a map of actors and the messages they have received.
      Returns:
      a map of actors and the messages they have received.

    • getEvents

      public Map<EventType,List<Event>> getEvents()
      Returns a map of event types and the events that have occurred.
      Returns:
      a map of event types and the events that have occurred.
